pullRequest.body:
We define the coroots of a finite-dimensional semisimple Lie algebra with coefficients in a field characteristic zero and establish the key property that a coroot is complementary to the kernel of the root.

In addition we carry out some related, light refactoring. The most important points are:

- Promote `LieModule.weight` from a subtype to a structure `LieModule.Weight` + expand its API (we need this expanded API for the headline results).
- Replace the definition `LieAlgebra.rootSpaceProductNegSelf` with its range which we call `LieAlgebra.corootSpace` (in all places where we used this definition, it was the range that we actually used).
- Drop the very old (unused) definitions `LieAlgebra.IsRoot` and `LieModule.IsWeight`.

---

I could split up this PR into two or three pieces and I am happy to do so upon request.


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors d+
This is great!

LGTM! One more comment.

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

```suggestion
/-- A weight of a Lie module is a map `L → R` such that the corresponding weight space is
```

```suggestion
instance instFunLike : FunLike (Weight R L M) L R where
```
Is this a good simp lemma for the global simp set? I can imagine both sides are useful, and the RHS isn't clearly "simpler".
I'm pretty keen on this being `simp` to establish the normal form as I've built all the API around the `IsZero` definition.
Please add a lemma `IsZero.eq` that can be used to rewrite along `(χ : L → R) = 0` using dot-notation.
Good point, done! (And indeed it is useful.)
Would it work to make this the actual definition? Or are there downsides to that?

Dot notation fails and I have to manually author lemmas for named fields if I just use a `Subtype`. Possibly (though I'm not sure) I also encountered undesirable `simp` lemmas when I experimented with `Subtype` instead of `structure`.

So I think this is the right choice but I'm happy to investigate further if you wish.
No need to investigate further, I'm convinced (-;

```suggestion
When `L` is semisimple over a field of characteristic zero, it is spanned by the coroot
```

Does this work? Also on the line below?
```suggestion
    x ∈ Submodule.span R {⁅y, z⁆ : H | (y ∈ rootSpace H α) (z ∈ rootSpace H (-α))} := by
```

Not quite but a slight variation does, thanks:
```suggestion
    x ∈ Submodule.span R ({⁅y, z⁆ | (y ∈ rootSpace H α) (z ∈ rootSpace H (-α))} : Set H) := by
```

Would you mind writing out the type of the existential, to improve readability a bit. (It's not that important, but since this is the step where you avoid char 0, I think it doesn't hurt to emphasize it.)
Good idea, done!
I think you can use the same nice set builder notation on this line.
Thanks; forgot to include that last time.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define the coroots of a semisimple Lie algebra

source.title: The roots of a Lie algebra are a root system.
